dialogues.text: Doing a relaxed 35 down the narrow ribbon of Route 17. Ru country. The weather's turned grey--making all the 19th vintage houses and barns they pass look dismal, if not a foreboding. Ahead of them,

dialogues.text: Anna--

dialogues.text: What movies?

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Ask me what I don't have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather and Cotter jammed in there like Spam, sharing a j watching "Curse of the Blair Witch" on DVD: The Interview Sequence with folklorist CHARLES MOOREHOUS explaining the â€œorigins" of the Blair Witch story--Elly K banishment, etc.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: What I never could figure about the movie?

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Three people: two guys, a girl-- sleeping in the same motel room, the same tent night after night.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: No fucking.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Made no sense. Scared out of their minds, and the greatest stress reliever in creation right at their fingertips. Nada.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: No sense at all. (beat) I'm a little stressed.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Try a long walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ain't the Ritz, but they did come prepared: air mattre Coleman lanterns, a kerosene heater--and heaps of books a brimming file folders. They're sitting up in their respective mummy-style sleepi studying documents, making notes-- --when this high-pitched MOANING can be heard outside the Nick and Anna looks at each other. Nick grabs one of the and dashes for the tent door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shines the light slowly out into the foundation ruins- --and there's Domini, still lying on her back, staring u

dialogues.speaker: DOMINI
dialogues.text: Oooh. Oooh.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Ah, Domini?

dialogues.speaker: DOMINI
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: You planning on sleeping out there?

dialogues.speaker: DOMINI
dialogues.text: Not planning on sleeping at all. She points up into the big oak in the middle of the found

dialogues.speaker: DOMINI
dialogues.text: Oooh. Oooh. The call comes back to her from the tree: "oooh-oooh." Nick sees perched high up on one of the branches: A GREAT OWL. It's staring down at them.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINI
dialogues.text: I figure I lie here long enough, maybe he'll swoop down and carry me off in his talons. Nick rolls his eyes and goes back into his tent.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER AND HEATHER
dialogues.text: are also watching this from their tent.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: We should be so lucky.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Butt-ugly owl. They duck back into the tent. The Owl keeps watching. FADE TO BLACK. Several beats. And then in the darkness, a rustling sound A whisper that sounds like:

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: ..see if it's alive-- CLICK! Then Anna's hand seen--she's just turned on one of lanterns. Sits up in her sleeping bag. Listens. The soun stopped. Beat. She gets out of her bag, grabs the lantern, and goe tent flap--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and just as she steps outside-- --something strikes her hand--

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: --shit-- --the lantern goes flying into the dirt-- --and suddenly out of the darkness come flying--

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE HANDS
dialogues.text: wielding small sharpened sticks--or are they tent pegs?-- --and they stab into Anna's belly again and again, accomp shrieks of delight. Anna screams--

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Who's James?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA TURNS
dialogues.text: and finds she's inside the tent, wrapped tight in her sle Staring at Nick, who's propped up on his air mattress wit and a lantern, staring quizzically back at her.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: (disoriented) What?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: You said the name "James."

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I don't know. She pulls her sleeping bag down, looks at her belly--unma unharmed, bloodless.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Baby names?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I don't know. Nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: You want me to scooch over next to you?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domini is still supine, staring upwards.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINI
dialogues.text: This place is like a regular K-mart of bad vibes, ain't it, pal? The Owl doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: (distant) Please, someone, help me--

dialogues.speaker: SMASH TO
dialogues.text: a static shot of dark, dark woods. The Voice continues to from somewhere deep in there:

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: --somebody, please!

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK
dialogues.text: It's coming from the DVD of "Blair Witch Project."

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER DONAHUE'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Josh?!?

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK FURTHER
dialogues.text: Cotter and Heather Arendt are fast asleep. Must have drif during the umpteenth viewing.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: (much louder) Heather??? Heather Arendt is up like a shot.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Heather?? Josh??? Mild snort of amusement when she sees the movie's still p the DVD. She buttons it off. Starts to lay back down--

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: (loud) Heather????  --bolts right back up on the verge of a coronary. The Man's Voice screams:

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: They're pulling my teeth out!! Heather literally punches Cotter awake.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Wha' the-- She clamps her hand over his mouth. Beat. They listen-- --suddenly, SCURRYING FOOTSTEPS heard; giggling--

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: (through her hand) --o-fug-me--

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Heaaaaather??? Cotter wrenches himself away, grabs his little 8mm camcor

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: (scared) What're you, crazy??

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: (exhilarated) What're you, nuts? He lunges out of the tent, camera already whirring--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and right into a blinding, light-up-the-night battery o lamps.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Jesus! Halo-ed in the glare of those lights stand

dialogues.speaker: FOUR LARGE TEENAGERS
dialogues.text: in various states of grunge. They all but scream of STONE them's got a huge running Beta-Cam on shoulder, another's a DAT recorder and shotgun mic. We see Cotter from the POV of these guys camera:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotter shooting back at them with his puny-by-comparison his thermal long-johns halfway down his legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check this out: Burkittsville's Funniest Home Videos. Cotter's still shaking.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Jesus-Jesus-Jesus-- A furious Heather can be seen scrambling out of the tent. right in the lens:

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What the fuck?!?

dialogues.speaker: CUT BACK TO
dialogues.text: The Stoner Cameraman snaps the Beta away from her.

dialogues.speaker: STONER CAMERAMAN
dialogues.text: Hey, that's 50K worth of hi-tech, chickee.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: You gave me a fucking heart attack!

dialogues.speaker: STONER
dialogues.text: Oh, and you boogied all the way up here to get a good night's sleep.

dialogues.speaker: STONER
dialogues.text: We just made your every dream come true, darlinâ€™.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: What're you doing with all this shit?

dialogues.speaker: STONER
dialogues.text: Shootinâ€™ "Blair Witch II," man-- what's your excuse?

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Shooting "Blair Witch II."

dialogues.speaker: STONER
dialogues.text: Oh, dude, I don't think so--that is just not happening.

dialogues.speaker: STONER CAMERAMAN
dialogues.text: This is our gig.

dialogues.speaker: STONER
dialogues.text: We got jurisdiction, man--we got fuckin' permits to be here.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah? Let's see "em.

dialogues.speaker: STONER
dialogues.text: They're, uh, like, in the car.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: STONER
dialogues.text: Let's put it this way: one of us is going, and it's you.

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What's the hassle here? Nick and Anna appear from their tent.

dialogues.speaker: STONER
dialogues.text: You and the Brady Bunch, Mr. Scorsese.

dialogues.speaker: STONER CAMERAMAN
dialogues.text: You're interfering with the commerce of independent film! Cotter asides to Nick.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: They're making "Blair Witch II," too.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: No problem, just give us 'til dawn and we're gone.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Look, guys, we're cold, we're tired we're shook--we just want to get out of here as soon as there's light. We saw something up at Coffin Rock today--

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: (catching on) --or someone--

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: --scared the living shit out of us.

dialogues.speaker: STONER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I don't know, I don't know--

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: --yeah, a hand or something--

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: --coming out of the water-- Now even Domini joins the prevarication party, popping up inside the foundation:

dialogues.speaker: DOMINI
dialogues.text: --stop it! Stop talking about it! I'm gonna freak!

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: (tearing up) I just wanna go home.

dialogues.speaker: STONER
dialogues.text: (impressed) Whoa.

dialogues.speaker: STONER CAMERAMAN
dialogues.text: You didn't get it on tape, didja?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Tried, but-- Stoner #2 starts barking orders to his crew:

dialogues.speaker: STONER
dialogues.text: Strip it down and ship it out! Coffin Rock! They're packed up and ready to move in a flash. Stoner #4 they trot off:

dialogues.speaker: STONER
dialogues.text: Any other voices or noises you hear tonight--it ain't us. The Stoners make Josh Leonard-like cries as they disappea into the darkness;

dialogues.speaker: STONERS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Heather??? Mike???? Somebody??? Please????

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: They were never seen again. Their footage was found a year later-- underexposed and useless.  Tired laughter.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: How're the cameras doing?

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Due for a re-load and battery check. I'll get on it.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: "Give you a hand. I think my sleep for the night just ended.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Join the club.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Well, everybody grab a coat, and pull up a rock for a night of witch-watch. The four campers proceed to their respective tasks. Domini stays perched on the foundation, watching where th disappeared. To herself:

dialogues.speaker: DOMINI
dialogues.text: Something....really twisted...is going to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up. The Owl's gone. FADE TO BLACK. Birds heard in the darkness. And snoring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cuddled together, fast asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domini conked out on the grass, curled in a fetal positio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ditto Heather, sprawled half-in/half-out of her sleeping Only Cotter is awake--well, making an attempt at it, anyw Squints at his digital watch: 5:45am.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Jesus...wha' happened... He groggily gets to his knees and dog-walks out of the te  Several beats. And then we hear outside the tent: The cries wake

dialogues.speaker: COTTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh, fuck me! Oh, Jesus! Heather--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --as well as Nick and Anna--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --even Domini, --and then she --five tripods, who pops her head up and starts to ask:

dialogues.speaker: DOMINI
dialogues.text: What happ-- sees; they all see--

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: --they're all gone!-- all minus the Video cameras they used to support--

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: --and none of â€˜em were mine! I-am-so-fucked, I-am-so-fucked-- where the hell was everybody???

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Asleep--

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: --what happened to the goddamn â€œWitch-watch??"

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: --I dunno, I just woke up--

dialogues.speaker: DOMINI
dialogues.text: --last thing I remember were those four clowns shooting the movie--

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: --yeah, the goddamn stoners! who you think stole the stuff!?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Yeah. Got to Coffin Rock, found zip, and came back, ripped off the cameras. Domini looks at one of the mangled tripods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ripped? They look like they were bit off.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Smells Like Teenage Spirit.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: This is funny?? This is tens of thousands of fucking dollars! (shouts into the woods) You pricks! I'll see you in fucking court!!

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Not the only things missing, Nick. Nick turns. Anna's at the tent door holding a pile of emp folders and two looseleaf notebooks that have somehow bee clean in half. Now Nick's incensed:

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: That's almost a year's worth of work! (into the woods) Scumbags! Oh, Jesus, Jesus....

dialogues.speaker: DOMINI
dialogues.text: At least you still have the tapes.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: One set. Everything from midnight on--

dialogues.speaker: DOMINI
dialogues.text: --no, I think they're all in there. She's pointing to the collapsed section of the basement f where the original â€œBlair Witch Project" Tapes were found The other four stop and stare at her. And then Cotter goes diving in the hole. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sonovabitch! And emerges with two grimy handfuls of VHS, Beta, and 8mm tapes.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Those ours? Cotter brushes dirt from them; holds them up for inspecti

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: My handwriting on the face  labels. And then his excitement switches to confusion. Turns to D

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: How'd you know they were--

dialogues.speaker: DOMINI
dialogues.text: (shrugs) --hunch. Just sort've saw 'em there.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: My ass--you saw those four fucking baboons put 'em there!

dialogues.speaker: DOMINI
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Cotter, I think she's right. Why would those guys go to all the trouble of stealing the camera and all this other stuff and leave the tapes?

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Spite.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: They were making a movie--if they were going to steal anything it'd be just the tapes, to see if we had anything they didn't.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINI
dialogues.text: I don't think it was them.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Oh, who did then? Blair Witch? Snatching equipment to make her own sequel?

dialogues.speaker: DOMINI
dialogues.text: I don't know yet.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Well, please keep me fucking informed!

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Those four guys--it's the only thing that makes sense. She looks over at Domini, who says nothing--just stares i woods.  EXT.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: This is a goddamn disaster. Let's just pack it up and go.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I want to see the tapes.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: And what do you possibly think you're going to fucking see there?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: No idea. But if that's all we've got left--

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: --nothing left to play â€˜em on, honey.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Oh, sorry, right.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: You can be goddamn sure, though, I'm going to be looking at every second of 'em when I get back to Baltimore--I get proof who stole my shit and I call the cops!

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: We're ticketed to fly back from Baltimore, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Me, too.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Hey, I got a whole editing suite in my loft--more the fucking merrier.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Pointless.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINI
dialogues.text: No. I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: STREET IN N. BALTIMORE
dialogues.text: The Van pulls up to the curb in a savagely decrepit and e desolate old industrial section of North Baltimore.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: 403 41st Street, kids: home.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I dunno it's safe to even get out  All four look: of the car.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: By day? No sweat.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: What about night?

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Not a great idea. Especially "cross the street. a thickly wooded area that looks like mostly sumac.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Druid Hill Park.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: That's a joke?

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: That's its name. A pastoral glade gamboling with crackheads and homeless and averaging at least one homicide a week.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Let's get inside.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: First enormous brick warehouse on your right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four of the five of them ride nervously in a huge, ancien that ascends in a series of jerks. Cotter's oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Used to be a meat-packing plant. Slaughter on the ground floor-- carcasses schlepped up on this thing for dissection and grinding and--

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: --Cotter: shut up.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotter opens the elevator grates, revealing a metal door single lock. He fits a key into it

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Just one lock in this neighbor- hood?

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: All I need-- --throws the door wide-- --the LOUD BARKING of what sounds like a pack of pit-bull them.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Get inside quick, they'll stop.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Too busy eating us?

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Just go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shuts the door; the BARKING stops. Everyone's eyes zap 360 degrees around them: no dogs. Cotter taps a small speaker above the door;

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Baltimore's cheapest burglar alarm. He re-opens the door a crack--the BARKING starts anew. Cl Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Had the door jimmied a few times. Nobody's yet made it inside. He ushers them into a huge

dialogues.speaker: DOUBLE-STORIED SPACE
dialogues.text: easily 30 feet high. Exposed brick walls--massive iron ro And crammed to bursting with bizarre esoterica everywhere --carousel horses, huge airplane propellers, a bowsp'rit old clipper ship, lawn jockeys, a set of bunkbeds made en wagon wheel parts, bowling balls, cannonballs, pinball ma

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Mi casa y su casa!

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Su casa y shit-o hole-o.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Hey, hon'--this is what pays the  rent and tuition.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Running a junk yard.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: A Cyber Entrepreneurialship.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: English.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: I spend a lot of time on e-Bay. Buying, selling--sometimes buying then re-selling at substantial mark-up, sometimes just selling crap I find in the street.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Looks like business is booming.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: There's some stuff that's hard to part with. Editing's stuff's up there-- --he points to a loft overhanging the big room--a thin wo railing separating the work space from a sheer 20 foot dr

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: --stairs are back through the kitchen--and a ton of bedrooms, you wanna dump your stuff or catch a nap--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotter's running tape through his new video iMac. The res are gathered around the screen in various degrees of disc They look like they've been there for some time. A lot of Nick's rubbing his temples like somebody's pounding a mar inside his head. ON SCREEN: they're all watching minute after minute of no Darkness. The outlines of the Parr Foundation. Trees in t ground. Silence. Several beats as they continue to watch this stasis. Then

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I think we get the gist.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: We've looked at half of one tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's four other angles, man, we haven't even--

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: --great: we can watch Domini sleep for hours--or, shit, maybe if we stay at it for a couple of days, maybe a deer'1l dash by!

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: For once could you just sit down, shut up, and give something a chance?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: We're leaving--case dismissed for lack of evidence. Maybe on the ride home we can figure how the fuck we're going to graduate with no thesis.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I'm not going anywhere, 'til--

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: --bullshit!

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Hey, chill, man--

dialogues.speaker: DOMINI
dialogues.text: --there's something here, Nick--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --he grabs Anna by the wrist and yanks her up--

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: --now c'mon!

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Get your goddamn-- --and suddenly Anna stops. Doubles over, clutching her ab

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: What--

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: --oh, Jesus-- --blood can be seen soaking through her jeans.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I need to go to a hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domini, Heather and Cotter standing grimly in the Waiting Finally, they see Nick exiting a Trauma Room, looking eve

dialogues.speaker: DOMINI
dialogues.text: She lost it. Nick nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna's lying on a OB/Gyn table in a johnnie, clearly seda with a face and eyes still soaked with tears. An E.R. INT (Female) is cleaning her up.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: INTERN
dialogues.text: Any number of reasons--pick one, it's as good as the other.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I was out hiking, camping the past two days--that's what did it--I killed it-- ~

dialogues.speaker: INTERN
dialogues.text: --doubtful, Mrs. Leavitt. The main thing to remember is, whatever the reason, it was for the best-- it meant something was wrong.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Something was wrong.

dialogues.speaker: INTERN
dialogues.text: Look, this is not my field of expertise. You seem stabilized, but why take any chances? Let's keep you overnight and have the Staff obstetrician do a follow-up tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I guess-- --and then Anna sees what the Intern is writing on her ch To see Boyd Kurth 5/26/00 Anna's eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: she flashes on the grave marker that Domini laid on in th Burkittsville Cemetery: same name, same date.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE TRAUMA ROOM
dialogues.text: Anna yells:

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: INTERN
dialogues.text: Mrs. Leavitt--

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: --I'm not staying here!

dialogues.speaker: INTERN
dialogues.text: Let's talk to your husband--

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: --he's not my husband! She's flails at the Intern, trying to chart.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Where are my clothes??

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. COTTER'S VAN
dialogues.text: get up, tearing pages from her They all sit silently as Cotter drives. The now-fully clo just sits in back like a zombie.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (softly) We'll stay overnight, get a hotel--

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: --Cotter's--

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: --whatever you want, no problem--

dialogues.speaker: NICK

dialogues.text: This could be something right here, do you think it's some- thing, Heather--? Heather doesn't even look up. She's just sitting on the b backed couch staring at Domini's 8"x10".

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: --but that could be just a shadow, I think it's a shadow, it's nothing, Heather, do you think it's nothing-- --and he just keeps prattling on oblivious, eyes fixed on moving at a snail's pace in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: It's about the tree, it's something about the tree. She puts it down on a cushion and snatches up the dog-ear the "Blair Witch Dossier." Easily flips to the page Domin her: Elly Kedward trussed in the wagon in the woods. Flips backwards in the book, looking for something--

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: --the goddamn tree, Domini, for chrissake, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and then she stops on the page that shows the anthropol studentsâ€™ sketch of the Parr foundation; the skinny littl in the middle-- --then back to the woodcut of Elly Kedward in the woods-- --then back to Domini's photo of the foundation--the huge

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Same trees. They took Elly Kedward out to the same kind of trees.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: (still oblivious)  --I look and look in the tree, all I ever see, he's always there watching, that stupid owl, over and over--

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: --Cotter, where can I get on-line?

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: --anywhere, anywhere, all up and live, all the time--fucking owl-- Heather slips in front of one of Cotter's PC's.

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT TO
dialogues.text: Heather on-line, in the middle of Blair Witch Chat Room, WICCA GIRL: anybody know where tree is they tied Elly Kedward? Beat. And then a response. COFFIN ROX: Black Hills Heather responds, types: WICCA GIRL: thanx--anybody know where??? in Hills Beat. Response: TREACLE-TREACLE-LITTLE-EILEEN: My two cts? By Rusty Parr' house hadda be that close how else could she whisper into his ear? Heather stops typing; absorbs this.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Cotter?

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Fucking owl!

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: You think it's possible the tree in the Parr foundation is the same one they tied Elly Kedward to?

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: No idea--goddamitt! And then suddenly another response appears in the Chat Ro COFFIN ROX: Check BW Cult book, 1809--they have full account Heather grunts. Types back:  WICCA GIRL: 1 copy in exist. you got it? COFFIN ROX: no just seen it WICCA GIRL: where COFFIN ROX: one of us WICCA GIRL: if you're out there and got it anybody, contact me this mailbx urgent COFFIN ROX: location described pretty good in section bout first boys disappeared afer Elly dies - James Kurth & another kid Heather stops typing. To herself:

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Boy Kurth.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Heather, does that look like Domini there? Heather doesn't look up from her screen. Impatient, tryin pieces that don't fit together.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Down there in the Park. Heather looks up. Cotter is looking down through the big huge windows; he's waving to someone. Heather gets up. Slowly peers over the loft railing. Squi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stark-naked Domini is standing in Druid Hill Park. Look them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather and Cotter's pace slows drastically as they try a navigate the overgrown pathways inside the Park. The flor below and above--moonlight barely penetrates where they'r

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Domini...? Cotter puts a finger to her lip. Whispers:

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Not the place you want to  announce your arrival.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: How's she going to know where to--

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: --things got a way of finding you here. They walk.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: It's freezing.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Next time try putting on shoes-- --the two of them stop dead in their tracks. Through the ahead of them they can see a clearing. Illuminated by the what appears to be an old

dialogues.speaker: WOODEN OX CART
dialogues.text: with SNOW drifted up nearly to the hubs of its wheels.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER AND COTTER
dialogues.text: are suddenly so cold they can see their breath in the air

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: What the fuck--??

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: --I don't know. He grabs her hand and pulls her through the thicket. They

dialogues.speaker: THE CLEARING
dialogues.text: the snow is now gone. Where the cart was is now just a st rotting cut brush. A clean-up effort someone must have st then abandoned. Heather and Cotter stare at each other, b and not a little afraid.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: The moon trying to shoot down through all these trees--can make things funky--

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: --I saw what I saw.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Yeah. Me too.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: The cart they brought Elly Kedward into the woods with--

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: --into the Black Hills with--200- something miles from here--

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: --Domini! They both see it at the same time:

dialogues.speaker: A NAKED WHITE BODY
dialogues.text: face down at the base of a tree. Heather races over, knee next to it.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus, what happened, are you-- --and Heather lets out a screech. The face of the body re ELDERLY MALE. Filthy, tongue lolling black out of its mou been dead for some time.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Be it still alive, James?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: What-- Heather turns--

dialogues.speaker: A PACK OF LITTLE BOYS
dialogues.text: wild-eyed and wielding sticks, RUSH AT HEATHER--

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: --then finish the job, lads! --Heather screeches again, throws up her arms to protect

dialogues.speaker: COTTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Jesus! Heather looks up: Cotter's lying on the ground, holding h bleeding forehead.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: What the fuck you do that for?? Heather looks at her hand. She's clenching a sharp stick The Little Boys are gone. The body of the Dead Man is not

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: I didn't.  She grabs his hand, pulls him up. They start running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather and Cotter at the table, still out of breath and as they tell Nick what happened.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: --and one of the little boys, his name was James. As in the boy James Kurth--the first child to disappear from the town of Blair after they banished Elly Kedward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A look of alarm comes to Nick's face. But he says nothing

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I dunno it's anything. It's a name Anna's mentioned--from her dreams.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: I can't handle this anymore. He produces a large, thick spliff and torches it up. Big passes it to Heather, who takes an even bigger one.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: How much of that stuff you guys been smoking?

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Enough to keep sane.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Enough to make shapes and shadows in the dark into something else.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Spare me.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Hey, chemicals, fear, sleep- deprivation--and a round-the-clock obsession with the occult--hell've a recipe for a mind-fuck.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Except we seem about 18 times more together than you. Heather spit-takes a lung-full of smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd strongly advise you to join us--

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: --before you lose your emotional lunch.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (shrugging) Yeah, what the hell. He takes the joint, sucks in mightily--

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Atta boy-- --and then the whole kitchen seems to explode-- --GLASS and MULLIONS from the big window in the room come in shards at them-- --and then when the noise finally stops, and the flying d all hit the floor, they all look down and see:

dialogues.speaker: A HORNED OWL
dialogues.text: broken and bleeding from its header through the window. S and then dying. Eyes wide, staring up at them. No one says a word. They just look at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of chairs, but nobody's sitting down. Cotter, Heath Nick all look like their nerves are fraying down to bare

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: We are being fucked with here, someone or something.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Domini.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Why in the world would she--

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: --why in the world would she just fly the coop in the first place?

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Chrissake: why any of this?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I think it's time to get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Nobody's going anywhere--

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: --hell, I don't think I'm ever leaving this place again--

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: --one of us, all of us--I have no idea--brought whatever this thing is back here. We're not going to go out there and spread it around like Typhoid Mary. We're gonna figure it out, we're gonna bring a goddamn end to it.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Domini's the only logical explanation.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: We're not dealing with fucking logic here!

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: It's Domini, it's not Domini, I don't care--all I know is I'm not dealing with something--anything-- snuffing me in my sleep. I want to do what we did in the woods-- surveillance of this whole place 24/7, with somebody monitoring those cameras every second. There's something, somebody here, I want to see 'em coming.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I thought all your equipment got stolen.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: All the shit that was worth anything, yes. You'd be amazed, though, what you can get free on the 'net. He opens a desk drawer--there must be a dozen little palm corders in there. INT. What huge cams

dialogues.speaker: THE LOFT
dialogues.text: Cotter lacks in other equipment, he makes up for with cab SPOOLS of it--and he's running it from the various tiny v to a motley bank of monitors he's set up on the kitchen t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: duct-tapes one of the little units on the top of a closet frame in the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: sees he has an excellent angle on the front door/elevator

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: watches half asleep and befuddled in their bedroom as Nic camera on a jerry-rigged broom-handle tripod.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: connects the cables in the kitchen--sees Anna and a clear the bedroom door.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: collaborate on installing a camera from Cotter's work-lof provides a view of the dark area under the work-loft. Nic the camera on a rope, while Heather guides and supports t attached.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: watches the camera descend on one of the monitors. Satisf view it's giving him, he yells:

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: That's good! Tie it off!

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE WORK-LOFT
dialogues.text: Nick does so. Ties the rope securely around the loft rail a slip knot in the loose end and lassoes it over one of t beams above to keep it from being a hazard. He has to jum the rope as it comes down again from the beam-- --stumbles backwards slightly as he catches it-- --hitting the spindly loft railing-- --which suddenly SNAPS! And Nick goes tumbling out into mid-air, the slip-knot in in his hand the only thing keeping him from plummeting 20 the floor below--

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: --Jee-zus!!!--

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: sees it happen on the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Christ!! He dashes out of the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE WORK-LOFT
dialogues.text: Heather is trying to lift Nick back up by the rope by she physical strength she doesn't have--

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: I can't do it!

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Don't! You're making me lose my grip.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm coming! I'm coming! And Cotter comes dashing in with a tall metal step ladder

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Just hold on!

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I can't! Cotter splays the ladder open, starts clambering up it

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Just let it go, I've got you!

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: What're you nuts--

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: --it's less than four feet just--

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: --shit!!! Nick loses his grip--starts falling-- --Cotter snatches hold of him as he falls, pinning Nick b ladder and his torso. The ladder wobbles precariously--

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: --don't move, don't even breathe-- --and then the ladder finally comes to a stable rest. Nick is savagely shaken as he slowly climbs down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesusjesusjesus.... Ditto Cotter:

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Yeah--please don't do that again. A giggle is heard from the doorway to the big room. They

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: is standing there, laughing with her hand against her mou little child. She sing-songs:

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I could see up your dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotter, Heather and Nick watch the monitors on the table silence. Drinking coffee. They all look majorly exhausted of them look in any immediate danger of falling asleep. T dart from monitor to monitor, relievedly seeing nothing-- Anna tossing restlessly in bed. Heather sees that Nick is massaging something on his fore making him wince. Without a word, she rolls his sleeve up A wine-colored mark that looks vaguely like a jagged J.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Gothic rune--the letter "S."

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Or a blood blister--or a bruise.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Must be that blue collar life we all lead. Cotter pulls up his pant leg: two blurry burgundy marks-- shapes overlapping each other.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: That's a "3.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: For "James?"

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Goes right along with these two. She pulls back her hair--where jaw meets neck: two smudge that together look like badly-drawn lowercase "n"s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put â€˜em together that's a "k." James Kurth--

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: --or Lyme Disease or poison sumac, or God knows what-else we could have picked up in the woods.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: You know what we picked up in the woods--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and then there's a sharp knock at the door. All three sets of eyes zoom towards the sound, but no one The knocking grows louder, more insistent. Still, they re frozen. Frightened. They look at the monitor giving an angle of the door/elev Nothing can be seen--just a dark blur in the door's peeph indicating someone's standing in the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: No one ever comes here.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Have to open the door to find out. The knocking increases, along with muffled shouts of:

dialogues.speaker: VOICE BEHIND THE DOOR
dialogues.text: Cotter...? Cotter...?

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: -I'll....go. Cotter gets up and slowly walks to the door. The rapping shouting increasing in volume with each step. Finally, a deep breath. And then Cotter looks through the hole. He sees:

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: his Techie friend from the Film Lab glowering back at him

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: I know you're in there, you piece of shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) You have to go.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: Not until I get that Beta Cam back! We're both in a world of shit here!!

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: (quietly) I can't.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: It's my fucking job, man!!

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: I can't let you in. Sid starts knocking again. Cotter walks back to the kitchen. Sits down in front of t monitors. Watches as the knocking continues. Finally stop expression on Cotter's face never changes.

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT TO
dialogues.text: So quiet, so tense, they can hear the clocks ticking all loft: 4:10a.m.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I should check on Anna.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Check the monitor, she's fine.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: She's far from "fine."

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: You're needed here--keep watching--

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: --f'chrissake, Heather, it's not like the two of us are gonna doze off he leaves for two seconds--

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: --I don't trust anybody, not even me, anymore--

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: --shhhh! #5, there's something up there! Their eyes all go to the Monitor with the view of Cotter'  loft. Beat. They freeze. A slight WHIRRING--then slow WHOOSHING heard. Movement se darkness. Cotter gets up.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: One of the printers.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: No. We all go.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Anna--

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: --fuck Anna!

dialogues.speaker: COTTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: No, you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotter handing a sheaf of print-outs to Heather.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: --it's for you. Came through email. How it started printing without a command, though-- Heather looks up at them in astonishment; dithered:

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: --it's the "Blair Witch Cult"--a copy-- some pages from--one of them on the site must've gotten my message-

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: --who?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Doesn't say--it's just these pages. She tries to make out the ancient, smeared scrawls of thi 200 year old book.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: (reading) "taken by the witch as they were marked by her--first Jamie Kurth when the stain appeared on his brow that next summer--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --the next page is illegible, Heather flips forward:

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: "for ttwas said he and Jon Edmunds and other boys who found Elly Kedward still on her tree in the snow. Poking her with sticks finding her still living. Taking her bonds and noosing them to her neck, hanging her from her tree until she perished." Heather looks up at the others in wide-eyed.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: That's the little boys. Elly Kedward didn't die from "exposure" out there: she was executed. (resumes reading) "Killing Elly Kedward, but not the witch herself, who floated from the mortal husk--" Heather looks up; she echoes Domini's words:

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: "It's why the witch kills children."

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I thought all witches were benign and good.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Not this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather tries to rouse Anna in bed.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: I need you to talk to me, talk to me about the dreams--about James, the other boys.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I don't...I don't understand them myself.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Try, please, Anna--

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: --bad boys, mean boys, cowardly boys--just like Domini.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A coward too. That's why she had to go.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: What happened to her, where did she go?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Don't know--just that she was afraid--

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: --Anna-- Anna winces.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: What, are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: My eye, is there something in my eye? Heather looks.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Not that I can see.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Closer. Lift the lid and look-- it hurts. Heather lifts Anna's eyelid, gets close to her face and l

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Closer. And Anna gently guides Heather's face down. Begins stroki the next thing Heather knows, her body is gravitating tow Anna's. She's kissing her, stroking and fondling her as A her fingers. Pulling down the covers, guiding Heather dow length of her body to-- --a spot on the mattress between Anna's legs that's soake with fresh, gleaming blood. Heather yanks herself away, now seeing that the entire ma blood-covered. Runs from the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather stares at her face in the mirrored surface of a t Blood blots on her cheek--vaguely in the shape of little prints. She's hyperventilating as she tells Cotter.  Nick enters. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Remember....what Mary Brown said-- she could see the witch's hands on my face, her mouth sucking on mine.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Anna's the witch.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: What the fuck's going on here?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Does she have marks, Nick--like the ones we have, that Domini had?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Does she, goddamnit??

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Not that I've seen--but that has no meaning--that means nothing.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Why was she exempted, Nick?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Maybe whatever they are, they just haven't appeared yet on her?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: You really believe that?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: It's possible for chrissake--

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: --the marks appear, then you disappear. Like the little Kurth boy, like Domini, as soon as they come to full bloom--and mine are She pulls down her blouse--the marks on her neck have gro are the size of--and very clear image of--the palm-prints child, ringing around Heather's neck as if strangling her

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Mine, too. And so are yours,  pal. He points to Nick's exposed midriff--the stains have spre his waist into his abdomen--

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Like a blueprint for disembowelment.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: There are other explanations! She is not the goddamn witch, that's insane!

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Then just give me one of your explanations that all three of us'll buy.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I don't.... --and then Nick hears giggling. His eyes and everyone's e one of the video monitors:

dialogues.speaker: THE BIG ROOM
dialogues.text: of the loft. Where they see Anna twirling round and round tip-toes, laughing, as though she were simultaneously bei and looking up the dress and giggling at the person being Now even Nick looks petrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Big Room. Nick enters on the run.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I want to see something!

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Whatever you want.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: The clothes--take â€˜em off-- I want to see every square inch--

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: --no, what's wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Watch on the monitor: Nick showing the huge mark on his t

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Are you marked like this??

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I see for proof positive you're the goddamn witch-- Anna dashes from the room.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: Heather grabs her, as Anna's trying to open the door to e recorded dogs start barking madly.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: You killed Domini, didn't you, witch??

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I'm not a witch, you're all crazy! Anna runs panicked into the kitchen--and right into Cotte grabs her by the arms.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: Just say you are--we won't hurt you-- --Heather runs in behind her--

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: --we'll just make you go away, so you can't hurt anyone else-- --Nick enters the kitchen--

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: --like you hurt the baby--

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: --what're you saying?? I didn't have anything to do with--

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: --the witch kills children--

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I haven't killed any--

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: --Jamie Kurth, Jonathan Edmunds--

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: (in terror) --my God, Nick???

dialogues.speaker: NICK
